dt: {bc}a prayer consisting of a series of invocations and supplications by the leader with alternate responses by the congregation

dt.t: The drug has a {wi}litany{/wi} of possible side effects.

et: Middle English {it}letanie{/it}, from Anglo-French & Late Latin; Anglo-French, from Late Latin {it}litania{/it}, from Late Greek {it}litaneia{/it}, from Greek, entreaty, from {it}litanos{/it} supplicant
shortdef: a prayer consisting of a series of invocations and supplications by the leader with alternate responses by the congregation
a usually lengthy recitation or enumeration
